plugins.name: Nisa Text
plugins.description:
Nisa Text version 2 üéâ


Unleash your creative potential with our game-changing Figma text editing plugin. Streamline tasks, boost productivity, and explore new horizons in design. Elevate your text editing experience today!


üëâ Release highlights:

  1. Wrap Text (PRO): Effortlessly align text to wrap around chosen shapes, including png/svg images for added versatility. Like in Adobe Indesign.
  2. Super Columns (PRO). Enjoy CSS-like multi columns to split text evenly into multiple columns.
  3. Circle Text (PRO). Create unique circular text by selecting an ellipse and defining the radius.
  4. Hyphenation. Select your text and add hyphenation to it.
  5. Texts To Variables (PRO). Easily move selected texts or frames into variables for convenient editing.
  6. Remove links: Remove all links from text.
  7. Support mixed text - Now you can split/join/etc. and you text style won't be lost!


Main: Split Text, Split Text Al (by alphabet), Split Word, Join Text

Alignment: Arrange Vertically, Arrange Horizontally

Manipulations: Sort, Sort By Length, Shuffle, Reverse, Remove Duplicates, Transform Text, Remove Links


üöÄ Upgrade to PRO and access exclusive text editing features and advanced tools.

accepted.name: Orkhan Jafarov
accepted.description: Sr. Frontend Engineer @ Amazon

plugins.name: Color Compass
plugins.description:
üåà Quickly navigate the color spectrum with designer-focused accuracy


Say goodbye to eyeballing and colour picking randomly from the colour palette!


Feed a base colour to this plugin by clicking on an existing element or updating the hex code and clicking 'Update'.


  1. Generate tints, shades, tones, and complementary colours to quickly build custom color palettes.
  2. Increase or decrease the step value to hone in on the exact shade you want.
  3. Experiment with different swatches and interact with elements directly from the plugin.
  4. Save favourite swatches and use them across all your Figma and Figjam files
  5. Drag and drop saved swatches as you go


---


Upgrade

You will be asked to upgrade this plugin after 10 uses. Upgrading is a one time payment of $30 and includes all future updates and unlimited usage. Thank you for your support!


You may contact the Figma team for a refund if you are unsatisfied with your purchase in any way.


---

‚û°Ô∏è To Use

  1. Run the plugin from Figma
  2. Select an element containing a fill, background, or stroke
  3. Click on the Update button
  4. Click on a plugin swatch while an element is selected to update a pre-existing fill, background, or stroke.


‚û°Ô∏è Usage Notes

  1. Copy the hex code from the plugin by clicking on the clipboard icon
  2. Save an active swatch by clicking on the star button
  3. You can keep clicking on Update to generate random colour palettes based on your previous colour selection.
  4. Click on the plus button in a palette to add the swatches to your document.
  5. This plugin will work on any element that is able to display a solid fill, stroke, or background
  6. Drag and drop saved swatches to reorder them


---

If you run into any bugs or have any feature requests please submit an issue on Github.

plugins.name: FireJet - Export Figma Design to Code | Tailwind | React | Vue | Svelte | HTML | TypeScript
plugins.description:
Convert Figma Designs into Responsive, Readable, and Pixel Perfect Code


üñ±Ô∏è How to use

  1. Select the frame
  2. Click Generate Code
  3. See code + rendered website within Figma


Frameworks Supported

  1. Typescript, React, Vue, Tailwind (BEST), HTML, Svelte, CSS

Best Figma to Tailwind Conversion

  1. We compared our code with other Figma to code tools using GPT, Claude, Gemini
  2. Check our this blog comparing FireJet with other Figma-to-code tools.

No setup required

  1. No need for auto-layout or any extra steps before generating code

Pixel Perfect

  1. Almost zero design leakage. Pixel perfect outputs with >90% accuracy

Responsive

  1. Generate responsive outputs by selecting multiple breakpoints for the same design

Semantic Tagging

  1. Detection and generation of complex semantic components

Componentization

  1. Figma components are generated as React components

Tailwind-First

  1. Support for custom Tailwind config and Tailwind defaults approximation


Reviews

  1. We have decided to continue using FireJet. In the coming months, we will be translating our Figma designs into Svelte + Svelte/Kit code, and we have found that FireJet is the best Figma plugin for this job. The Svelte code is good quality. We are long-term customers.

Useful Links

plugins.name: Glyphs
plugins.description:
Discover the wonderful world of glyphs, ligatures, emojis, and other symbols and characters right in Figma design and FigJam whiteboard using the Glyphs plugin.


The plugin currently includes 184 Unicode Blocks.


How to use:

  1. Drag the glyph from the plugin window and Drop anywhere on the canvas.
  2. Left-click on a glyph to paste onto the canvas or into the text layer(s).
  3. Right-click on a glyph to copy it to the clipboard.


Supported objects:

  1. Texts;
  2. Connectors;
  3. Shapes with text (Square, Ellipse, Diamond, etc.);
  4. Sticky notes;
  5. "Code block" snippet (experimental).


Note:

Some fonts may not include all the characters that you see in the plugin. If you don‚Äôt see a glyph after pasting, this means that the glyph doesn't exist in the font. Please select a glyph layer and select a different font in the Figma properties panel or use the Change Font plugin.


The glyph and block names are from the Unicode Character Database.


Donation:

You can support the development and maintenance of this plugin by donating via destream.


Creator:

Yury Zeliankouski


My other projects:

  1. Change Font plugin;
  2. Translation Suggestions plugin;
  3. Code Block to File plugin;
  4. Base64 plugin;
  5. Translate widget;
  6. How many Sticky Notes? widget.

accepted.description:
UX/UI designer. Figma expert. Developer of plugins and widgets for Figma and FigJam.

plugins.name: Symbol Icons Browser
plugins.description:
Symbol Icons Browser makes it easy to browse and copy symbols from SF Symbols, Material Icons font and Font Awesome.

# Ready to use
To use this plugin, Please install San Francisco font Material Icons font (.ttf) and Font Awesome (.otf).

San Francisco font: https://developer.apple.com/fonts/
Material Icons font (.ttf): https://github.com/jossef/material-design-icons-iconfont
Font Awesome (.otf): https://github.com/FortAwesome/Font-Awesome

# Usage
1. Find the symbol you want to use
2. Click the symbol

# Click Options
- Copy: copy symbol glyph to clipboard
- Copy&Paste: copy and paste symbol glyph to selected text objects
- Create: create new symbol glyph as a text object on the canvas

plugins.name: Ghost
plugins.description:
How it Works

Ghost recursively detects all nodes in a selection. It then measures their dimensions before replacing them with shapes; the original layers are removed. To generate a layout faithful to the original, Ghost removes properties like auto-layout, effects, strokes, and fills, thereby preventing anomalies that occur when inserting placeholder shapes onto the canvas.


A Note on Frames

Since a frame has varied uses‚Äîcreating components (e.g., buttons, toggle switches, etc.) and containers (e.g., cards and screens)‚Äîaltering or removing its background color may prove disruptive. Accordingly, Ghost instead detaches and retains each frame's background color while removing strokes and effects.


Basic Usage

  1. Select a shape, text box, or an entire screen.
  2. Select a color.
  3. Ghost!


Recommended Usage

Loading is a state specific design akin to disabled or destructive, hover or active. Create a ghostified loading variant.


Roadmap

A color picker‚Äîdepending on whether Figma‚Äôs new input parameters add support for HTML-like inputs like input type=color.


End Notes

I‚Äôm relatively new to Typescript and working with Figma‚Äôs API in general. For questions and (constructive) feedback, send me a message.
plugins.tagline: Ghost is a lightweight plugin that converts high fidelity mockups to loading or ‚Äúskeleton‚Äù screens.

plugins.name: FigmaToFlutter
plugins.description:
GET FLUTTER CODE FOR FIGMA SELECTIONS

Flutter generator will look through what you select and write out the flutter equivalent


EASY COPY AND PASTE

Stateless code? Stateful? Or just the widget code? Flutter generator renders them all for easy copy and paste


RENDER WHAT YOU NEED

Flutter Generator will do a one-to-one conversion of what you select in Figma into Flutter code (v1.12.13+hotfix.8).


SENSIBLE EDGECASES

So, do you want your image inside a Container()? Or the background of the Container()? Or just an AssetImage()? Flutter generator has dedicated options for edge cases like these, so there will be more than one way (and more in the future) of rendering an item.


ASSET MANAGEMENT

- Exporting images from the UI to match the flutter code. No need for a roundtrip

- Font Names and their data are prepared/formatted for your convenience in your pubspec.yaml file


Flutter Generator is starting in Beta, with the following functionality out of the box (More to come in updates):


- Rectangles/Ovals/Lines (Basic shapes)

- Solid colors

- Images (AssetImage, Container Backgrounds)

- Google fonts generation

- Pubspec code snippet for third party dependencies

accepted.name: Seme Mojugbe
accepted.description: I'm a UI Designer/Developer with a focus on building products and tools for developers and their frameworks

plugins.name: Export Original Images
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to export images from your selection without any crop and in their native size.


If you ever received a design without the images used in the file attached, this plugin is here to help.


How to use:

  • Select one or multiple elements having an image in their Fill property or simply a frame
  • Run the plugin
  • Customize the settings
  • Save your selection on your computer


Settings:

  • Format (PNG or JPEG)
  • Quality (JPEG only)
  • Selection (Export all layers in the selection or only the direct selection)


Good to know:

  • If you select only one image, the plugin will export that image directly.
  • If you select multiples images, a zip file will be exported.
  • The original metadata of the images cannot be exported, only the original pixels are.
  • The plugin can be slow when you have large images loaded in your design. Try exporting one image at a time if it seems to be stuck.

plugins.name: UI Color Palette„ÉªWCAG-Compliant Color Palette Suite
plugins.description:
Figma UI3 is now supported!


UI Color Palette is a Figma and FigJam plugin that creates, manages, deploys, and publishes consistent and accessible color palettes. The plugin uses alternative color spaces, like LCH, OKLCH, CIELAB, OKLAB, and HSLuv, to create color shades based on the configured lightness scale. These spaces ensure WCAG standard compliance and sufficient contrast between information and background color.


---


Share your ideas and submit your feedback at a single place: ui-color-palette.canny.io


---


Why UI Color Palette


Create your accessible palette in seconds

‚ñ° Pick your brand colors directly or pull from Coolors, Realtime Colors, or Colour Lovers (1M+ palettes)

‚ñ° Set up lightness levels using preset systems like Material 3, Ant Design, IBM Carbon, or make your own

‚ñ° Pick your preferred color space: LCH, LAB, or HSLuv

‚ñ° Use ready-made palettes from our community


Manage the color scaling that complies with WCAG

‚ñ° Check contrast with WCAG 2.1 and APCA

‚ñ° Build light and dark themes

‚ñ° Test for colorblindness

‚ñ° Fine-tune text contrast


Sync the colors with styles, variables, and third-party plugins

‚ñ° Link colors to styles and variables

‚ñ° Send to Tokens Studio


Transfer the palette to development

‚ñ° Get Style Dictionary tokens

‚ñ° Export for Tailwind

‚ñ° Generate code for SwiftUI, UIKit, Kotlin, and XML


Publish the palette for reuse and sharing

‚ñ° Store palettes in the cloud

‚ñ° Share with other users

‚ñ° Browse and use community palettes


---


Useful links


Have help

‚ñ° Read the documentation

‚ñ° Contact support


Get involved

‚ñ° Submit feedback

‚ñ° Share your ideas


Give support

‚ñ° Follow the plugin LinkedIn page

‚ñ° Follow the author


---


If you find UI Color Palette useful, please share it with your colleagues!


---


‚ñ° Website: www.ui-color-palette.com

‚ñ° UI Color Palette 4.3 newsletter: uicp.ylb.lt/whats-new


‚ñ°Browser complete compatibility: Figma Desktop App, Google Chrome, Opera, Microsoft Edge, and other Chromium-based browsers.

‚ñ°Partial compatibility: Mozilla Firefox, Apple Safari


---


The plugin is open-source. Feel free to both watch or fork the repository, or request a merge.


Made by Aur√©lien Grimaud, Senior Product Designer based in Paris.

plugins.name: Figma to Dora - publish 3D websites, zero code
plugins.description:
Design in Figma, Build in Dora. Create Websites with Ease.


With this plugin, you can effortlessly transfer your Figma design into Dora. Just paste, add interactions, and publish your creation as a fully functional webpage. Dora also supports the use of 3D models and CMS data!


Here's how you can use the plugin:


  1. Install. Install the Figma to Dora plugin.
  2. Copy. Select the content you want to copy in Figma, run the Figma to Dora plugin, and it will save the content to your clipboard.
  3. Paste. Paste the content onto your project page in the Dora. All layer names and groups will be fully preserved.


üìö Learn more at https://dora-design.notion.site/Import-from-Figma-8322e748846a473aa6e71c14bab17e4d


üìÄ Watch tutorial https://youtu.be/v_xPsgwMf6E


After importing to Dora


üåê Static Image ‚Üí 3D Model or Video

From Figma designs, any static graphics can be replaced with a real 3D model or video using Dora. Experience the visual impact of static images coming to life!


üí° Polish ‚Üí Add Creative Animation

Dora has powerful animation and interaction capabilities, making it easy to create stunning effects, such as scroll-based animation.

plugins.name: Translator
plugins.description:
Translator enables you to translate your text layers to other languages right in Figma. With support for over 130 languages, you can now test your designs in other languages, catch localization layout issues quickly, bring your designs to new locales, and communicate with international team members in Figma and FigJam documents.


Plugin Features


  1. (NEW) Mixed text style support ‚Äî Translator will transform your carefully crafted mixed text styles to other languages in a way that makes sense for those languages.
  2. (NEW) Design translation ‚Äî Select and translate individual text layers or select entire groups, sections, or frames. Now you can select an entire design and translate it to another language with a single click.
  3. (NEW) Table support ‚Äî Select a FigJam table and click Translate. Translator will translate the text from every cell instantly.
  4. Support for over 130 languages.
  5. Integration with Figma's Quick Actions allow you to bypass Translator's interface entirely and translate designs faster.
  6. Translator's intelligent selection detection means you can use the same one button workflow to translate entire layers, groups of layers, or just the selected text of a text layer.
  7. Supports both Figma and FigJam ‚Äî Not only can you translate text in your Figma documents, you can translate entire frames, tables, text in shapes, sections, and stickies in your FigJam documents too.
  8. Keyboard input mode for when you need to translate some text quickly that may not be available as a text layer in your document: communicating with international teammates, translating text variables, etc.
  9. Dark mode support.

accepted.name: Dustin Mierau
accepted.description: Cofound and led design at Path. Helped build Napster for macOS. Making Figma plugins that I find useful in my own work and hope you do too. üòä

plugins.tagline: Language superpowers for Figma.

101560.description:

With support for over 130 languages, you can now test your designs in other languages, catch localization layout issues quickly, bring your designs to new locales, and communicate with international team members in Figma and FigJam documents.


Plugin Features


  1. (NEW) Mixed text style support ‚Äî Translator will transform your carefully crafted mixed text styles to other languages in a way that makes sense for those languages.
  2. (NEW) Design translation ‚Äî Select and translate individual text layers or select entire groups, sections, or frames. Now you can select an entire design and translate it to another language with a single click.
  3. (NEW) Table support ‚Äî Select a FigJam table and click Translate. Translator will translate the text from every cell instantly.
  4. Support for over 130 languages.
  5. Integration with Figma's Quick Actions allow you to bypass Translator's interface entirely and translate designs faster.
  6. Translator's intelligent selection detection means you can use the same one button workflow to translate entire layers, groups of layers, or just the selected text of a text layer.
  7. Supports both Figma and FigJam ‚Äî Not only can you translate text in your Figma documents, you can translate entire frames, tables, text in shapes, sections, and stickies in your FigJam documents too.
  8. Keyboard input mode for when you need to translate some text quickly that may not be available as a text layer in your document: communicating with international teammates, translating text variables, etc.
  9. Dark mode support.

plugins.name: Sorter
plugins.description:
A plugin for sorting/reordering layers.


‚Ä¢ Sort by Position ( Left, Right -> Top, Bottom)

‚Ä¢ Sort Alphabetical Ascending (A -> Z)

‚Ä¢ Sort Alphabetical Descending (Z -> A)

‚Ä¢ Reverse order

‚Ä¢ Randomize order


How it works:

Sorter will take your selection and sort the layers using the ordering of your choice, relative to each items parent. This means you can have a mixed selection of top level frames, and child elements and the plugin will always sort them without throwing errors.


If you only want to sort children of your selection, enable the "Sort Children Only" option. Sorter will remember your selection for the next time you run the plugin in that file.


Open sourced on Github:

https://github.com/thomas-lowry/sorter

plugins.name: Change Font
plugins.description:
Change the fonts of selected objects using the quick actions bar in Figma and FigJam.


The list displays of both Google Fonts and local fonts with previews.


At first:

Save the plugin to your Figma account so you can run it via Quick actions.


What's next:

  1. Select text object(s) or range of text.
  2. Open the quick actions (press ‚åò Cmd + / on Mac or Ctrl + / on Windows).
  3. Type Change Font and press Tab.
  4. Filter the list by typing the font name.
  5. Select the desired font by pressing Enter/Return.
  6. Done! Font changed.


Supported objects:

  1. Texts;
  2. Connectors;
  3. Shapes with text;
  4. Sticky notes;
  5. Tables;
  6. Code block.


The plugin can apply local text styles, this happens automatically. It is important that the properties of the selected text layer (such as: font size, line height, letter and paragraph spacings, etc.) fully match the properties of the local text style.


Note:

The list of results is limited to 500 fonts. To see other fonts, enter any characters in the input field.


Donation:

You can support the development and maintenance of this plugin by donating via destream.


Creator:

Yury Zeliankouski


My other projects:

  1. Glyphs plugin;
  2. Translation Suggestions plugin;
  3. Code Block to File plugin;
  4. Base64 plugin;
  5. Translate widget;
  6. How many Sticky Notes? widget.

accepted.description:

https://destream.net/live/tank666/donate

plugins.name: SVG Animate
plugins.description:
SVG Animate allows you to create stunning animations with ease. No need for complicated workarounds and going deep into the code. Instead, you can create animations individually on every element of your Figma creation by using a simple but powerful animation editor.


How it create SVG Animations:

  1. Select the Frame you want to animate and click on Enable SVG Export.
  2. Select a node within that Frame to set up animations such as X Position, Y Position, Scale, Rotation and Opacity.
  3. Use the built-in live-preview to tweak your animations until you're happy with the result.
  4. Download or copy the animated SVG and paste it on your website.


How to use SVG Animations on my Website:

  1. SVG Animate uses a small web component library under the hood to make your animations work.
  2. This library uses GreenSock GSAP, a powerful, lightweight and performant animation engine.
  3. When exporting from SVG Animate, you can download or copy the snippet with the click of a button, and paste it on your website. No complicated setup needed.

accepted.description: entrepre_nerd

plugins.tagline: Bring your Figma creations to life with stunning animations and seamless export to web and video.

plugins.name: Jira
plugins.description:
Note: This plugin does not work with Jira Server or Jira Data Center


Get full context when turning designs to code with the Jira plugin for Dev Mode. With this plugin you can link Jira issues to Figma pages or layers so you always have the relevant info you need.


Use the plugin to‚Ä¶

  1. Import and link existing Jira issues to pages or layers in a Figma file, so that when developers are implementing designs they have all the relevant context they need easily accessible.
  2. View linked Jira issues directly in Figma, to help reduce context switching when additional context from Jira is needed during design implementation.
  3. Create new Jira issues directly from Figma, so that you can stay in flow even if you realize new issues need to be created as part of planning or handoff.


You can also attach Figma designs to issues in Jira and have them appear in Dev Mode, so you have all the relevant details on your project, always. Learn more here: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217865/figma-for-jira?tab=overview&hosting=cloud


Learn more about Dev Mode here (https://help.figma.com/hc/en-us/articles/15023124644247)


---

This plugin is licensed under Figma‚Äôs Terms of Service, unless you have a different agreement with us for Figma Services, and any use of Jira is subject to your agreement with Atlassian.

plugins.name: Bannerify Banner Studio
plugins.description:
Documentation & Video Tutorials


For plugin documentation and step by step video tutorials, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/bannerify


Questions & Support


Bannerify is still a baby panda, so if you notice any bugs or have any questions about the plugin, please get in touch directly via https://hypermatic.com/contact and we'll help you troubleshoot and resolve them as quickly as possible.


Security


Bannerify is designed to be privacy and security focused ‚Äî for details about security and how the plugin works, please visit https://docs.hypermatic.com/bannerify/security


Features


  1. Criminally easy timeline animation and real-time previews inside Figma.
  2. Generates all the images, HTML, CSS and Javascript you need for every banner.
  3. Export your animated banners to GIF, MP4, WebM or animated WebP files.
  4. Embed Lottie file animations or MP4 video files to any layers in your timeline.
